ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is to learn how to translate Qing documents which are written in traditional Chinese, and how to decipher the text by putting it in context. Strong recommend!
This class is absolutely crucial for your success in the Chinese history PhD program.
I would recommend the course, particularly if they were interested in Qing history.
Yes, because it is comprised of interesting stories and in-depth discussions.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It increased my familiarity with a number of sources that could come in hand in the future.

This course is particularly helpful to my future research in terms of looking at how frontiers have been imagined, represented, negotiated, and in general, reconstructed. It enriched my knowledge in Chinese history by providing a critical and comprehensive context.
